intro: Thyrsanthema ebracteata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved thrysanthema, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It is often found in coastal and sandy habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Thyrsanthema ebracteata is adapted to arid conditions and is a common species in southern Australian flora.
